prompt:
Describe the spatial relationships in this diagram.

CONTAINMENT: Which text labels are inside or outside each closed curve?
CONNECTIONS: Which text labels are connected by lines? Note any branching or unconnected lines.
BOUNDARY CROSSINGS: Do any lines cross the boundaries of closed curves?
NESTING: Are any closed curves nested inside others?

Do not interpret meaning. Only describe what you see spatially.
evaluation:
# Spatial Relationships in the Diagram

## CONTAINMENT
- The text "impundlee" (or similar handwritten text) is contained **inside** a closed oval/elliptical curve
- No text labels appear outside the closed curve

## CONNECTIONS
- A horizontal line extends from the **left side** and connects to the oval shape
- The line appears to pierce through or connect to the left boundary of the oval
- No branching is visible
- The line does not connect to any other text or shapes beyond the oval

## BOUNDARY CROSSINGS
- Yes, the horizontal line **crosses into** the left boundary of the oval
- The line enters the oval from the left side and terminates inside or at the boundary

## NESTING
- There is only **one closed curve** (the oval) visible
- No nested curves are present
- No curves exist inside other curves
